events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection causing front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and photographic evidence submitted.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customerâ€™s auto accident claim to facilitate communication and processing.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and outlining the next steps for claim processing.
Request sent to the claimant for additional documentation including police report, photos of damage, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including the police report and multiple repair quotes for vehicle damage.
The investigation team began assessing the claim details, damage reports, and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of liability on the other party and validation of claimed vehicle damages.
A settlement proposal was communicated to the customer detailing the approved repair costs and coverage terms.
Customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling of the vehicle collision claim.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the settlement agreement and quoted repair work.
Insurance payment was issued directly to the repair shop as per the approved settlement to expedite vehicle repairs.
The claim was closed successfully after all payments were processed and the customer's vehicle repairs were completed.
Final documentation and claim records were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
